CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Nevertheless , this performance is more than double of the highest PCE ( 1.1% ) reported to date for μmR - polymers , even when the spectral mismatch in the NIR region above was considered.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency)

The material name entity in the paragraph is "PCE." PCE stands for photovoltaic conversion efficiency, which is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electricity. It is expressed as a percentage and is an important parameter for evaluating the performance of solar cells. In this context, PCE is used as a benchmark for comparing the performance of different μmR-polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency)

I have removed the irrelevant entity and kept only the material name entity in the paragraph, which is "PCE." PCE is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electricity, and it is an important parameter for evaluating the performance of solar cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Nevertheless , this performance is more than double of the highest PCE ( 1.1% ) reported to date for μmR - polymers , even when the spectral mismatch in the NIR region above was considered.

Let's think step by step.

1. Performance
2. Highest PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
3. Spectral mismatch in the NIR (Near-Infrared) region

These are the "Property Name" entities in the given paragraph. These entities represent the characteristics or attributes of certain objects or concepts being discussed.

1. Highest PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)

This is the only entity in the given paragraph that clearly refers to a material property. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) is a property of materials used in solar cells and other energy conversion devices, and the "highest" value is a characteristic of that property. The other entities in the paragraph, "performance" and "spectral mismatch in the NIR region," are more general concepts and do not specifically refer to material properties.
